1.text: Awake, awake; put on your strength, O Zion; put on your beautiful garments, O Jerusalem, the holy city: for from now on there shall no more come into you the uncircumcised and the unclean.

2.text: Shake yourself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O Jerusalem: loose yourself from the bands of your neck, O captive daughter of Zion.

3.text: For thus said the LORD, You have sold yourselves for nothing; and you shall be redeemed without money.

4.text: For thus said the Lord GOD, My people went down aforetime into Egypt to sojourn there; and the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

5.text: Now therefore, what have I here, said the LORD, that my people is taken away for nothing? they that rule over them make them to howl, said the LORD; and my name continually every day is blasphemed.

6.text: Therefore my people shall know my name: therefore they shall know in that day that I am he that does speak: behold, it is I.

7.text: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him that brings good tidings, that publishes peace; that brings good tidings of good, that publishes salvation; that said to Zion, Your God reigns!

8.text: Your watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the voice together shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when the LORD shall bring again Zion.

9.text: Break forth into joy, sing together, you waste places of Jerusalem: for the LORD has comforted his people, he has redeemed Jerusalem.

10.text: The LORD has made bore his holy arm in the eyes of all the nations; and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.

11.text: Depart you, depart you, go you out from there, touch no unclean thing; go you out of the middle of her; be you clean, that bear the vessels of the LORD.

12.text: For you shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the LORD will go before you; and the God of Israel will be your rear guard.

13.text: Behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalted and extolled, and be very high.

14.text: As many were astonished at you; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:

15.text: So shall he sprinkle many nations; the kings shall shut their mouths at him: for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which they had not heard shall they consider.
